paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: early-onset neuropathy with sensory and motor symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 32 with early-onset neuropathy.
Patient P2 presented with significant autonomic dysfunction at age 40.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic despite being a carrier.
Patient P4 was diagnosed at age 68 with severe symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The Val40Met variant leads to destabilization of the TTR tetramer, promoting amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.population_frequency: Variant is found in 1% of the population in endemic areas.
variants.additional_notes: The Val40Met variant is the most common mutation associated with ATTRv.
key_quotes: The most frequent mutation worldwide is Val30Met that in endemic areas is typically associated with early‐onset phenotype.
Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 32 with early-onset neuropathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
